definition: to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)

sentences.english: She just stands up laughing, kicking the mosquito-incense holder back under the table.
sentences.chinese: 她只是笑吟吟地站起身来，将蚊香盘踢到桌子底下”。

sentences.english: Feili Miss Xiaojinjin machine on the teacher said.
sentences.chinese: 菲郦尐姐笑吟吟哋怼机噐老师说。

sentences.english: He always smiles when he speaks.
sentences.chinese: 他说起话来总是笑吟吟的。

sentences.english: This time, she saw my grandmother cheerfully toward her.
sentences.chinese: 这次，她看到祖母笑吟吟地向她走来。

sentences.english: I think you may take that liberty , the Doctor answered, smiling.
sentences.chinese: “我看你可以自由发问，”医生笑吟吟地说。

sentences.english: Behind the counter a tall, thin man was cheerfully greeting customers.
sentences.chinese: 柜台后面有个高高瘦瘦的男人在笑吟吟地招呼顾客。

definition: like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
to have a smile on one's face
smiling wholeheartedly (idiom); beaming from ear to ear
to be calm and unruffled in the midst of chaos or at a busy time (idiom)
to put on a fake smile (idiom)/to smile insincerely
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
